snippet: Booz Allen Hamilton has become one of the largest and most profitable firms in the United States almost exclusively by serving one client: the government.
abstract: Booz Allen Hamilton, technology consulting company that employs Edward J Snowden, who says he leaked national security documents about government surveillance, has become one of largest and most profitable corporations in United States almost exclusively by serving federal government; company earned $1.3 billion, 23 percent of its revenue, from intelligence work during its 2012 fiscal year.

byline.original: By BINYAMIN APPELBAUM and ERIC LIPTON
byline.contributor: Christopher Drew contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Booz Allen Hamilton has become one of the largest and most profitable firms in the United States almost exclusively by serving one client: the government.

headline.seo: Booz Allen Grew Rich on Government Contracts
headline.main: Leaker’s Employer Is Paid to Maintain Government Secrets
headline.print_headline: Leaker’s Employer Became Wealthy By Maintaining Government Secrets

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
